Name: Tomato Septoria Leaf Spot
Description: Tomato Septoria Leaf Spot is a common fungal disease that affects tomato plants, caused by the fungus Septoria lycopersici. It typically starts as small brown spots on the lower leaves of the plant and can quickly spread, causing the leaves to turn yellow and eventually die off. The disease can significantly reduce the yield of the plant if left untreated.

Treatments.Crop rotation: Plant tomatoes in a different location each year to reduce the build-up of fungal spores in the soil.

Treatments.Disease-resistant varieties: Choose tomato varieties that are resistant to early blight to reduce the likelihood of infection.

Products.Chlorothalonil: Such as Bravo, can be effective in controlling early blight. These products can be applied preventively or at the first sign of disease.

Products.Bordeaux: These products are often used in organic farming.

Products.Mancozeb: A contact fungicide that works by preventing spores from germinating and infecting the plant.
